results.title: Basketry
results.brief_description: This film examines basketmaking techniques from around the world, demonstrates the two principal techniques used in basketmaking and shows how both modern and traditional materials can be used. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Basketball: the free throw
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basketball Skills”.
One in a series of films on basketball skills, giving instruction and demonstration of basketball techniques, including slow-motion action and training routines. With Bill Foster and Gail Goodrich.

results.title: Basketball techniques for girls
results.brief_description: This film gives a clear demonstration and explanation of basic skills: Basic movement skills; running, starting, stopping, turning, passing, finger control, movement with the pass, leading the receiver, choice of right pass, shooting, finger control, arm extension wrist flip, choice of the right shot, dribbling, faking and pivoting. No other credits available.

No other credits available.

results.title: Basketball strategy for girls
results.creator_credit: Educational Productions and Young America Films
results.brief_description: The use of planned strategic play on the basketball court. Demonstrates offensive moves such as fakes, rolls, cuts, variances of pace, the figure eight and defence strategies such as player to player and basic zone, shifting zone, triangle, and diagonal defences.

results.title: Basketball fundamentals. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: The University of Cincinnati basketball team demonstrate the fundamentals of dribbling, passing, shooting, body handling and defensive play. Practice and drill on each skill can produce expert players. No other credits available.

results.title: Basketball fundamentals for boys
results.brief_description: Branch McCracken, Indiana basketball coach and his Hoosier team demonstrate the fundamentals of shooting, passing, dribbling, defensive and offensive footwork. No other credits available.

results.title: Basketball for girls [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday, Jean Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description: This film shows basketball as a game of skill, based on cooperative team play. It is presented in eleven sequences to enable discussion and clarification of the points in each. A short description of the game follows, then particular aspects are fully explained and demonstrated. Common faults are shown and the necessity for regular practice of court system is stressed.

results.title: Basketball diaries
results.creator_credit: Scott Kalvert, Liz Heller and Island Pictures
results.brief_description: ‘The Basketball Diaries’ is a horrowing growing-up story based on the true-life exploits of poet and musician Jim Carroll. Jim begins as a high-school basketball star at a Catholic high school where he experiments with drugs and is physically abused by his teachers. When his best friend dies of leukemia, Jim’s life suddenly becomes much more than adolescent angst, with him making the dark descent into the hell of heroin addiction and hustling. Jim’s poetry is the only thing he has left when he is found, literally on the street, by a tough ex-junkie, who undertakes his rehabilitation. Cast include: Leonardo Di Caprio, Bruno Kirby, Juliette Lewis and Ernie Hudson.
